intro: Clarisia strepitans var. paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense clarisia, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are often visited by pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its stems are woody and can grow quite long, allowing it to climb trees and other vegetation. The leaves are typically glossy and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental value in tropical gardens.
